TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit CloudMediaProvider extends Android.Content.ContentProvider

Docs.summary: Base class for a cloud media provider.

remarks.para: Base class for a cloud media provider. A cloud media provider offers read-only access to durable media files, specifically photos and videos stored on a local disk, or files in a cloud storage service. To create a cloud media provider, extend this class, implement the abstract methods, and add it to your manifest like this:

When defining your provider, you must protect it with the CloudMediaProviderContract#MANAGE_CLOUD_MEDIA_PROVIDERS_PERMISSION, which is a permission only the system can obtain, trying to define an unprotected CloudMediaProvider will result in a SecurityException.

Applications cannot use a cloud media provider directly; they must go through MediaStore#ACTION_PICK_IMAGES which requires a user to actively navigate and select media items. When a user selects a media item through that UI, the system issues narrow URI permission grants to the requesting application.

Media items
A media item must be an openable stream (with a specific MIME type). Media items can belong to zero or more albums. Albums cannot contain other albums.
Each item under a provider is uniquely referenced by its media or album id, which must not change which must be unique across all collection IDs as returned by #onGetMediaCollectionInfo.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created andÂ shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.OS.Bundle OnGetMediaCollectionInfo(class Android.OS.Bundle extras) cil managed
abstract member OnGetMediaCollectionInfo : Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.OS.Bundle

Docs.summary: Returns metadata about the media collection itself.

remarks.para: Returns metadata about the media collection itself.
This is useful for the OS to determine if its cache of media items in the collection is still valid and if a full or incremental sync is required with #onQueryMedia.
This method might be called by the OS frequently and is performance critical, hence it should avoid long running operations.
If the provider handled any filters in extras, it must add the key to the ContentResolver#EXTRA_HONORED_ARGS as part of the returned Bundle.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created andÂ shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: to modify the way the fd is opened, there's none at the moment, but some might be implemented in the future
used by the OS to signal if the request should be cancelled
Docs.summary: Returns the full size media item identified by mediaId.
Docs.returns: read-only file descriptor for accessing the media file

remarks.para: Returns the full size media item identified by mediaId.
If you block while downloading content, you should periodically check CancellationSignal#isCanceled() to abort abandoned open requests.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created andÂ shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Android.Content.Res.AssetFileDescriptor OnOpenPreview (string mediaId, Android.Graphics.Point size, Android.OS.Bundle? extras, Android.OS.CancellationSignal? signal);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Content.Res.AssetFileDescriptor OnOpenPreview(string mediaId, class Android.Graphics.Point size, class Android.OS.Bundle extras, class Android.OS.CancellationSignal signal) cil managed
abstract member OnOpenPreview : string * Android.Graphics.Point * Android.OS.Bundle * Android.OS.CancellationSignal -> Android.Content.Res.AssetFileDescriptor

Docs.param: the dimensions of the thumbnail to return. The returned file descriptor doesn't have to match the size precisely because the OS will adjust the dimensions before usage. Implementations can return close approximations especially if the approximation is already locally on the device and doesn't require downloading from the cloud.
to modify the way the fd is opened, e.g. for video files we may request a thumbnail image instead of a video with CloudMediaProviderContract#EXTRA_PREVIEW_THUMBNAIL
used by the OS to signal if the request should be cancelled
Docs.summary: Returns a thumbnail of size for a media item identified by mediaId
Docs.returns: read-only file descriptor for accessing the thumbnail for the media file

remarks.para: Returns a thumbnail of size for a media item identified by mediaId
The cloud media provider should strictly return thumbnail in the original CloudMediaProviderContract.MediaColumns#MIME_TYPE of the item.
This is expected to be a much lower resolution version than the item returned by #onOpenMedia.
If you block while downloading content, you should periodically check CancellationSignal#isCanceled() to abort abandoned open requests.

format.a: Java documentation for android.provider.CloudMediaProvider.onOpenPreview(java.lang.String, android.graphics.Point, android.os.Bundle, android.os.CancellationSignal).

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Database.ICursor OnQueryAlbums (Android.OS.Bundle extras);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Database.ICursor OnQueryAlbums(class Android.OS.Bundle extras) cil managed
abstract member OnQueryAlbums : Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.Database.ICursor override this.OnQueryAlbums : Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.Database.ICursor

Docs.param:
containing keys to filter album items:
  • CloudMediaProviderContract#EXTRA_SYNC_GENERATION
  • CloudMediaProviderContract#EXTRA_PAGE_TOKEN
  • CloudMediaProviderContract#EXTRA_PAGE_SIZE
Docs.summary: Returns a cursor representing all album items in the media collection optionally filtered by extras and sorted in reverse chronological order of CloudMediaProviderContract.AlbumColumns#DATE_TAKEN_MILLIS, i.
Docs.returns: cursor representing album items containing all CloudMediaProviderContract.AlbumColumns columns

remarks.para: Returns a cursor representing all album items in the media collection optionally filtered by extras and sorted in reverse chronological order of CloudMediaProviderContract.AlbumColumns#DATE_TAKEN_MILLIS, i.e. most recent items first.

The cloud media provider must set the CloudMediaProviderContract#EXTRA_MEDIA_COLLECTION_ID as part of the returned Cursor#setExtrasBundle. Not setting this is an error and invalidates the returned Cursor.
If the provider handled any filters in extras, it must add the key to the ContentResolver#EXTRA_HONORED_ARGS as part of the returned Cursor#setExtrasBundle.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created andÂ shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

abstract member OnQueryDeletedMedia : Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.Database.ICursor

Docs.param:
containing keys to filter deleted media items:
  • CloudMediaProviderContract#EXTRA_SYNC_GENERATION
  • CloudMediaProviderContract#EXTRA_PAGE_TOKEN
Docs.summary: Returns a Cursor representing all deleted media items in the entire media collection within the current provider version as returned by #onGetMediaCollectionInfo.
Docs.returns: cursor representing deleted media items containing just the CloudMediaProviderContract.MediaColumns#ID column

remarks.para: Returns a Cursor representing all deleted media items in the entire media collection within the current provider version as returned by #onGetMediaCollectionInfo. These items can be optionally filtered by extras.

The cloud media provider must set the CloudMediaProviderContract#EXTRA_MEDIA_COLLECTION_ID as part of the returned Cursor#setExtrasBundle. Not setting this is an error and invalidates the returned Cursor.
If the provider handled any filters in extras, it must add the key to the ContentResolver#EXTRA_HONORED_ARGS as part of the returned Cursor#setExtrasBundle.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created andÂ shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
